scriptmanager.objects.ArchTEx

Class CorrExtract

  • java.lang.Object
    • scriptmanager.objects.ArchTEx.CorrExtract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CorrExtract
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Helper object for ArchTEx Cross-Correlation analysis to parse BAM files and extract tag counts to correlate into a CorrNode object. This is
    Code largely sourced from ArchTEx.analysis.corr.CorrExtract in https://github.com/WilliamKMLai/ArchTEx Primarily modified to use ScriptManager's version of htsjdk.
    Author:
    William KM Lai
    See Also:
    CorrParameter, CrossCorrelation

    • Constructor Detail

      • CorrExtract

        public CorrExtract(java.io.File i,
                   CorrParameter param,
                   java.util.Vector<CorrNode> nodes,
                   int current,
                   int size)
        Pass necessary parameters to perform extraction (multi-threaded)
        Parameters:
        i - the BAM file to extract pileups from
        param - the stored Cross-Correlation parameters for how to perform extraction
        nodes - the set of CorrNodes storing the extracted values
        current - the start of the subset nodes in the list to extract for
        size - the length or how many nodes from "current" in the node list to extract for

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()

        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • extractRegion

        public java.util.Vector<double[]> extractRegion(CorrNode current,
                                                CorrParameter param)
        Extract from BAM file for a specific node.
        Parameters:
        current - the specific node to extract read counts for
        param - the parameter options used to configure extraction
        Returns:
        the list of forward and reverse tag count primitive arrays

      • resetProgress

        public static void resetProgress()
        Resest the progressCounter and currentProgress to 0.
